<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Shadowcaster Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3009) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 226 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Shadowcaster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=101)

**Prerequisites**
ability to cast spells

</column>

---

You've sacrificed a piece of your spirit, allowing the powers of shadow into your being and changing the nature of your magic. You can no longer cast spells that have the [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) trait; if an ability, such as a class feature or ancestry feat, would automatically grant you a light spell, such as the [Domain Initiate](/Feats.aspx?ID=265) feat granting you the [_dazzling flash_](/Spells.aspx?ID=412) spell, you don't gain that spell.

 You gain the [_cloak of shadow_](/Spells.aspx?ID=407) domain spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell. This feat grants a focus pool of 1 Focus Point that you can recover using the [Refocus](/Actions.aspx?ID=71) activity. You can Refocus by meditating to siphon power from the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11) and refill your focus pool. Your domain spells from the shadowcaster archetype are of the same tradition as the spells you used to meet the shadowcaster archetype's prerequisites.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the shadowcaster archetype.

<title level="2">Shadowcaster Dedication leads to...</title>
[Disciple of Shade](/Feats.aspx?ID=3011), [Shadow Reservoir](/Feats.aspx?ID=3013), [Shadow Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=3012), [Shadow Spells](/Feats.aspx?ID=3010), [Unending Emptiness](/Feats.aspx?ID=3015)
name: Shadowcaster Dedication
